Gartner believes that by 2018, multichannel application development that covers smartphones, tablets, TV widgets, PCs and every type of consumer electronics device will become a mainstream, converged set of tool choices available for mobile app development. CIOs in B2C and B2E industries need to build a multichannel strategy that takes into account the evolution of mobile app development, or face the prospect of falling behind in the competition to deliver an always-connected, multi-device reality.

und.safe_value: How are today’s companies approaching their mobility strategy for the wide array of enterprise workers they serve, from increasingly mobile “knowledge workers” to field technicians, drivers, delivery personnel, shop floor managers, and more? Well, it turns out that 68% of Netcentric Strategies’ Mid-Year Enterprise Mobility Survey respondents plan to reengineer their business around enterprise mobility. At the same time, 43% deem mobility to be “critical” to their companies’ success, with another 47% rating it “very important.” Join this free one-hour webinar featuring Kate Quackenbush, VP Product Marketing of Kony Solutions and Kevin Benedict, mobile analyst with Netcentric Strategies, to learn about the key trends in mobile enterprise strategies today.

und.safe_value: At the start, the rush to engage customers on smart phones and tablet was a modern day equivalent of the gold rush. Developers jumped in, using all kinds of tools and technologies. But now many organizations are moving beyond tactical approaches - they are moving toward strategic exploitation of multi-channel, mobile first development for customers, employees and business partners. Join Forrester Principal Analyst, Jeffrey Hammond, and Kony CTO, Sriram Ramanathan, to learn about the evolution of mobile development, and how developers are building, deploying, and managing apps that are context driven, flexible, and cost effective.
und.value: At the start, the rush to engage customers on smart phones and tablet was a modern day equivalent of the gold rush. Developers jumped in, using all kinds of tools and technologies. But now many organizations are moving beyond tactical approaches - they are moving toward strategic exploitation of multi-channel, mobile first development for customers, employees and business partners. Join Forrester Principal Analyst, Jeffrey Hammond, and Kony CTO, Sriram Ramanathan, to learn about the evolution of mobile development, and how developers are building, deploying, and managing apps that are context driven, flexible, and cost effective.

name: content
title: The Evolution of "Mobile First" Development

und.safe_value: Se você está apenas começando a explorar uma estratégia móvel, ou já tem um plano em prática, é fundamental entender como as constantes mudanças no ambiente de mobilidade afetarão suas decisões hoje e amanhã.  Com a adoção explosiva de dispositivos móveis, ultrapassando a utilização de PCs no Brasil, novas oportunidades de negócios e relacionamento se abrirão, mas você precisará atender as expectativas de usuários cada vez mais exigentes no uso de mobilidade.

und.safe_value: The adoption of iPads by Enterprises has been skyrocketing with more than 400 million expected to infiltrate organizations across many industries by 2015. While industries like Life Sciences, Insurance, Manufacturing and Retail have been leading the trend with the highest number of iPads purchased, their use is largely untapped and limited to an app or two for a particular function. Join this webinar to hear about the valuable use cases on how to effectively leverage iPad as an integral part of your enterprise mobility strategy.

title: You’ve Got the iPads for Your Enterprise.. Now What?

und.safe_value: Ya sea que Ud. está empezando a explorar una estrategia móvil, o ya tiene un plan establecido, es crítico entender como el panorama cambiante de movilidad de consumo afectará sus decisiones. Con la adopción de movilidad sobrepasando el uso de PCs en Latinoamérica, la expectativa de los usuarios va a ir más allá de lo básico. Está listo a cumplir con las necesidades de los clientes y empleados al tiempo que el uso de dispositivos móviles crece?

und.safe_value: Join Kony’s Chief Mobility Officer, Sam Lakkundi, and Sky Technologies’ CTO, Stephen Ware, to learn more about Kony’s recent acquisition of Sky.  As enterprise mobility and empowering the mobile user has shifted from ‘nice-to-have’ to ‘must-have,’ both companies have focused on simplifying and accelerating the mobility process. Discover how merging Sky’s extensive B2E and SAP experience with Kony’s award-winning mobile platform and configurable, pre-built apps furthers this goal and will provide a complete, proven, end-to-end mobility and multichannel solution.

und.safe_value: The recent decision by the Supreme Court to uphold the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act will mean that 49.1 million individuals in the US will be required to  sign up for health plans within the next 18 months.  For payers who have previously focused on an employer customer acquisition strategy, this means a dramatic shift towards direct to consumer marketing.  What is the best way to reach these new potential members?  It’s by employing a multi-channel approach – whether via smartphones, tablets, mobile or desktop web applications.

und.safe_value: Insurers are in the midst of change brought on by mobile initiatives. It’s a key business technology priority over the coming year, creating competing priorities for both the business and IT organizations. To be successful insurers must decide whether or not to retain end-to-end control of the mobile platform, how to deploy solutions, and how to reach customers on the device they choose. Register to hear Forrester Senior Analyst, Ellen Carney address these key questions and describe how to create a strategy that protects the mobile investment.

Kony is proud to sponsor PhoCus Wright’s webinar titled, “PhoCus Wright’s Consumer Travel Survey” on November 9 presented by Carroll Rheem, Director of Research. Join us as the PhoCus Wright research team talks about some of the findings in their recent consumer travel survey.

name: content
title: PhoCusWright's Consumer Traveler Technology Trends

und.safe_value: Join Liz Boehm, principal analyst for Customer Experience in Healthcare and Life Sciences at Forrester Research, and Aaron Kaufman, general manager and vice president of Healthcare and Life Sciences at Kony, as they will discuss current mobile adoption and ongoing mobile initiatives being driven by health insurers.
und.value: Join Liz Boehm, principal analyst for Customer Experience in Healthcare and Life Sciences at Forrester Research, and Aaron Kaufman, general manager and vice president of Healthcare and Life Sciences at Kony, as they will discuss current mobile adoption and ongoing mobile initiatives being driven by health insurers.

name: content
title: Forrester Analyst on Mobile Insights for Health Insurers – Drive Adoption and Improve Access to Care

und.safe_value:
How do you make technology decisions that will keep up with the pace of change? A new mobile banking vendor survey by TowerGroup reveals the new criteria required to support shifting mobile needs.
Presented by George Tubin, TowerGroup
und.value:
How do you make technology decisions that will keep up with the pace of change? A new mobile banking vendor survey by TowerGroup reveals the new criteria required to support shifting mobile needs.
Presented by George Tubin, TowerGroup

name: content
title: Beyond Basic Mobile Banking: New Criteria for a Winning Solution

und.safe_value: Join Peter Sheldon, Senior Analyst at Forrester Research as he explores the challenges organizations face as they grapple to keep up with the pace of change and mobile expectations of their customers. In the webinar, Peter will explore technologies including platform development, HTML5 and hybrid apps that are helping to lower the costs of implementing a cohesive mobile strategy in 2011.
und.value: Join Peter Sheldon, Senior Analyst at Forrester Research as he explores the challenges organizations face as they grapple to keep up with the pace of change and mobile expectations of their customers. In the webinar, Peter will explore technologies including platform development, HTML5 and hybrid apps that are helping to lower the costs of implementing a cohesive mobile strategy in 2011.

name: content
title: Mobile Commerce: Maintain A Rich Customer Experience And Keep Pace With Change

und.safe_value:
The “mobile wallet” is a technologically complex and potentially massive undertaking. Is there is a prudent approach that businesses can take to adapt and compete in the rapidly evolving, competitive marketplace?

This webinar examines the reasons driving financial services companies to adopt a mobile application strategy, the challenges they will face, and the best practices that lead to a cost effective extension of brands, products and services into the mobile arena.

title: Survey of Travelers Reveals Importance of Multi-Device, Cross-Channel Mobile Strategy

und.safe_value:
Thursday, August 30, 2012-  7 AM PST/ 3 PM GMT

Learn why organizations don't have to choose whether to support HTML5 or native mobile apps. Find out from lead analyst firm Gartner what's driving the adoption of these technologies and how to determine the best course of action for your organization. Discover a proven "Write Once, Run Everywhere" solution that enables you to support enterprise-grade apps for HTML5 and native technologies from a single code base.

title: Gartner - HTML5 VS. Native Mobile Apps
